meanings.definition: The act of selling goods in small quantities from place to place.
meanings.sent1: She admired the pedleries of the street vendor as he moved from house to house.
meanings.sent2: The market was filled with various pedleries, from handmade jewelry to fresh produce.
meanings.sent3: The pedleries of the traveling salesman always brought a smile to the townspeople's faces.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like pedleries, enticing customers to buy into her ideas.
meanings.sent5: The colorful display of pedleries caught the eye of every passerby.

meanings.definition: The goods sold by a peddler.
meanings.sent1: He carefully packed his pedleries into his cart before setting off for the day.
meanings.sent2: The pedleries on display ranged from trinkets to household items.
meanings.sent3: The children were fascinated by the pedleries, begging their parents to buy them toys.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was filled with pedleries of memories from her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The pedleries gleamed in the sunlight, tempting customers to take a closer look.
